meanings.definition: A transverse part of a cruciform church, crossing the nave at a right angle.
meanings.sent1: The transept of the church extended sideways.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the transept to intersect the nave.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons nested in the transept, thinking it was a cozy corner.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas crossed the transept of tradition, bringing in a new perspective.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight flooded the transept, illuminating the stained glass windows.

meanings.definition: A wing of a building that intersects the main structure at a right angle.
meanings.sent1: The school added a new transept for the art classrooms.
meanings.sent2: The transept of the house provided extra space for the family room.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the transept of the house a perfect spot for napping.
meanings.sent4: The new office building's transept connected seamlessly with the existing structure.
meanings.sent5: The garden in the transept of the building bloomed with colorful flowers.
